title: 10-Year Treasury Yield Hits 3% for First Time Since 2018
sub_head: Prices for Treasurys, corporate bonds, municipal debt have slumped in response to Federal Reserve moves to rein in inflation
body:
The worst bond rout in decades hit a new milestone Monday, with the yield on the 10-year Treasury reaching 3% for the first time since late 2018.
The yield on the benchmark 10-year Treasury note, which rises when bond prices fall, surged at the start of U.S. trading and reached as high as 3.008% in the afternoon, as traders braced for the outcome of this weekâ€™s Federal Reserve meeting. It then slipped below 3% to settle at 2.995%, according to Tradeweb , up from 2.885% Friday.
